issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

fields.summary: Private IP address is show in the PUBLIC ADDR column

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
When an instance is launched with no public IP assigned option, on AWS, the attribute 'ip_address' is returned empty, implying that no public IP is assigned to the instance. 

However, unlike AWS, on Eucalyptus, it appears that the private IP gets assigned to the 'ip_address' attribute in case of no public IP.

This issue was detected on GUI when the instance was displaying its private IP on the PUBLIC ADDR field on the instance landing page. See the ticket https://eucalyptus.atlassian.net/browse/GUI-1543
fields.summary: in VPC mode, Eucalyptus assigns private IP to 'ip_address' attribute when no public ip is assigned.

comments.body: This behavior is not specific to VPC, instances in EC2-Classic also return the private IP as the public IP when there is no public IP: {code} # # euca-run-instances --addressing private emi-ccc389ab RESERVATION r-e6af4148 339813695777 default INSTANCE i-609c38e0 emi-ccc389ab pending 0 m1.small 2015-02-05T00:00:46.181Z PARTI00 monitoring-disabled 0.0.0.0 0.0.0.0 instance-store # # # euca-describe-instances RESERVATION r-e6af4148 339813695777 default INSTANCE i-609c38e0 emi-ccc389ab euca-172-27-100-203.eucalyptus.internal pending 0 m1.small 2015-02-05T00:00:46.181Z PARTI00 monitoring-disabled 172.27.100.203 172.27.100.203 instance-store hvm sg-9e48465d TAG instance i-609c38e0 euca:node 10.111.1.13 # # {code} Response message: {code} 9d2e93a6-9cbc-427e-b95b-47cede9c2d96 r-e6af4148 339813695777 sg-9e48465d default i-609c38e0 emi-ccc389ab 16 running euca-172-27-100-203.eucalyptus.internal NORMAL: -- [] 0 m1.small 2015-02-05T00:00:46.181Z PARTI00 disabled 172.27.100.203 172.27.100.203 sg-9e48465d default x86_64 instance-store /dev/sda1 hvm euca:node 10.111.1.13 {code}

[~sjones]: Is the "instances in EC2-Classic also return the private IP as the public IP when there is no public IP" behavior a bug that needs to be fixed in Eucalyptus, or are we leaving that as-is for now?
[~kgill], not sure. We'd need to discuss the scope of any fix.
According to investigation by [~kyolee] AWS leaves the public IP empty in the API call, so it seems like the Euca behavior is not AWS compatible.
Maybe try to do something for only VPC mode although it may be a hack.

Example AWS/EC2 response for a VPC instance without a public IP: {code} 298624c6-8481-4dfc-b3a6-???????????? r-???????? ???????????? i-???????? ami-42908907 16 running ip-172-31-9-90.us-west-1.compute.internal steve 0 t2.micro 2015-02-13T00:04:31.000Z us-west-1c default disabled subnet-???????? vpc-???????? 172.31.9.90 true sg-???????? launch-wizard-6 x86_64 ebs /dev/xvda /dev/xvda vol-???????? attached 2015-02-13T00:04:35.000Z true hvm JoClI1423785870887 xen eni-???????? subnet-???????? vpc-???????? ???????????? in-use 06:68:1a:ed:1a:af 172.31.9.90 ip-172-31-9-90.us-west-1.compute.internal true sg-???????? launch-wizard-6 eni-attach-???????? 0 attached 2015-02-13T00:04:31.000Z true 172.31.9.90 ip-172-31-9-90.us-west-1.compute.internal true false {code}

VPC instances no longer return a public IP value/element when the instance does not have a public/elastic IP. Non-vpc instances still return the private address as the public address when the instance does not have a public/elastic IP.
Yay [~sjones] you are my hero! Thank you!

Fix Verified. Installed Packages Name : eucalyptus Arch : x86_64 Version : 4.1.1 Release : 0.0.23137.50.20150326gitf965d79.el6 In VPC if subnet is set to not map a public IP then there is no Public IP assigned for instances if they are in that subnet. Also, the original EC2 classic behavior of using private addressing results in private IP being set as public IP. VPC with do not map public IP by default set for subnet. {code} [root@g-12-02 ~]# euca-modify-subnet-attribute subnet-2bdc6050 -m false [root@g-12-02 ~]# euca-describe-subnets subnet-2bdc6050 SUBNET subnet-2bdc6050 available vpc-9fdeca1f 172.31.0.0/20 4091 one true false [root@g-12-02 ~]# euca-run-instances -k adminkey emi-178d9a2b RESERVATION r-b29eec14 706589908340 default INSTANCE i-7d032cdf emi-178d9a2b 172.31.1.252 pending adminkey 0 m1.small 2015-03-30T17:54:00.972Z one monitoring-disabled 172.31.1.252 vpc-9fdeca1f subnet-2bdc6050 instance-store hvm sg-1e6e7c6f x86_64 NETWORKINTERFACE
